name: Hong Kong Straights Expansion
description: A variant of Hong Kong Traditional scoring that adds additional sequence based rules to the game.

rules.name: Self Flower
rules.description: Either flower of your seat
rules.notes: If you are the first to play, your flower number is 1. Each subsequent player's flower number is 1 higher than the previous player.

rules.name: No Flowers
rules.description: Having no flowers

rules.name: Flower Set
rules.description: A full set of flowers of the same color

rules.name: All Flowers
rules.description: Drawing all 8 of the flowers.
rules.notes: In some variations, this counts as an automatic win.

rules.name: All Sequences
rules.description: Every set is a sequence

rules.name: Dragon Pong
rules.description: Pong/Kong of any dragon

rules.name: Round Wind
rules.description: Pong/Kong of the current wind

rules.name: Seat Wind
rules.description: Pong/Kong of the player's wind.
rules.notes: The dealer's seat is East, second player is South, third is West, and fourth is North.

rules.name: Self Draw
rules.description: Winning by drawing a tile from the wall
rules.notes: This can be from the front or back of the wall.

rules.name: Concealed Hand
rules.description: Winning without showing any melds from the hand

rules.name: Robbing the Kong
rules.description: Winning off of another player's kong

rules.name: Last Tile
rules.description: Winning off the last tile in the game, drawn or discarded

rules.name: Kong Replacement
rules.description: Drawing the winning tile from a kong (does not stack with self-draw)

rules.name: Replacement Self Draw
rules.description: Winning by drawing a tile from the wall
rules.notes: This can be from the front or back of the wall.

rules.name: Pure Double
rules.description: Two runs of the same suit and same numerical sequence.
rules.notes: In some variations, this only scores if the hand is also concealed.

rules.name: Outside Hand
rules.description: A hand that includes Terminals and Honors in each set, including the pair.

rules.name: Simple Hand
rules.description: A hand formed without Terminal or Honor tiles.

rules.name: Mixed Straight
rules.description: A straight (tiles 1-9) formed by sequences from all three suits.
rules.notes: The sequences must be exactly [1, 2, 3], [4, 5, 6], and [7, 8, 9].

rules.name: Mixed Triple Sequence
rules.description: Three runs of the same numerical sequence, one in each suit.

rules.name: Pure Straight
rules.description: A hand using tiles 1-9 from any one suit, forming three consecutive sequences.

rules.name: All Triplets
rules.description: Hand is composed of all pongs or kongs

rules.name: Mixed One Suit
rules.description: A Hand composed of only honor tiles and tiles from one suit.
rules.notes: This can be a mix of pongs, kongs, and chows.

rules.name: Double Kong Replacement
rules.description: Drawing the winning tile from a kong (does not stack with self-draw)

rules.name: All Pairs
rules.description: Hand of 7 unique pairs, does not stack with concealed hand.
rules.notes: Having four of the same tile is not a unique pair.

rules.name: Knitted Straight
rules.description: Hand with 147 258 369 of different suits, an additional meld, and a pair. 147, 258, and 369 count as chows for scoring.

rules.name: Knitted Lesser Honors
rules.description: 147 258 369 of different suits with honor tiles instead of melds and an eye. Honor tiles can replace parts of the straight.

rules.name: Pure One Suit
rules.description: All tiles from a single suit.
rules.notes: This can be a mix of pongs, kongs, and chows but cannot include honor tiles.

rules.name: Knitted Greater Honors
rules.description: 147 258 369 of different suits with honor tiles instead of melds and an eye. Honor tiles can replace parts of the straight. Must have one of each honor to score this level.

rules.name: Lesser Dragons
rules.description: Melds of 2 dragons and a pair of the 3rd dragon

rules.name: Greater Dragons
rules.description: Melds of all 3 dragon tiles.

rules.name: All Honors
rules.description: A hand with only honor tiles.
rules.notes: This does not stack with All Triplets because it is implied.

rules.name: Small Winds
rules.description: Melds of 3 winds and a pair of the 4th wind

rules.name: Four Great Winds
rules.description: A hand with melds of all 4 winds.

rules.name: Thirteen Orphans
rules.description: One of each one, nine, wind, and dragon, and a 14th tile (any other terminal or honor tile)

rules.name: Nine Gates
rules.description: Hand in any one suit consisting of exactly 1112345678999 and an extra tile of that suit.

rules.name: All Kongs
rules.description: Hand containing four Kongs and a pair.

rules.name: All Terminals
rules.description: Hand containing pongs or kongs of only one and nine tiles.

rules.name: Concealed Triplets
rules.description: Hand containing four concealed (unmelded) triplets.
rules.notes: The bonus can only be won by concealed self draw unless the discarded winning tile forms the pair, not any of the four melds.

rules.name: Blessing Of Heaven
rules.description: Dealer wins with their starting hand.
rules.notes: Does not stack with concealed hand.

rules.name: Blessing Of Earth
rules.description: Player wins on the first discard.
rules.notes: Does not stack with concealed hand.
